item.title: How New York City Routinely Fails to Pay the Nonprofits It Relies On
item.description: The city owes at least $1 billion to nonprofits for more than 7,000 unpaid invoices, according to a new report. The organizations provide critical ser...

item.title: This Year’s Met Gala Raises the Most Money in Its History
item.description: The Met’s annual fashion party has become a fund-raising juggernaut, but the lavish event comes with a price tag of its own. How much bang does it get...

item.title: Congress’s Fight Over Trump’s Agenda Runs Through Alaska
item.description: Republicans in Congress are clashing over whether to repeal Biden-era clean energy tax credits that are a lifeline for some of their constituents.

item.title: In the Battle for Next Pope, Cardinal Erdö Emerges as a Conservative Favorite
item.description: The archbishop is a standard-bearer for those in the church who favor a return to traditional rules and doctrine after Pope Francis.

item.title: As Conclave Nears, Catholics Wonder if New Pope Will Support Latin Mass
item.description: In Detroit, traditionalist Catholics were bracing for a crackdown. The promise of change in Rome offers them a sliver of hope.
